answers.answer: I can't believe he told you that :-P.  A baby's weight is based on genetics mainly.  If you have gestational diabetes that will affect your babies weight because of the unregulated sugar in your system.But no. my last pregnancy I gained 25lb, my baby was 8lb 11oz.  His father was a 9lb baby, and I was a 6lb baby.  Thats how I was always told to base what your baby may weigh.

Yeah...I agree with the above posters...total moron!! It has nothing to do with what you eat...it has to do with gestational age at birth, genetics and medical conditions...lol. What a weird thing for a doctor to say!!

Yup, my hubby was full term. I was born full term. Our son was as well. I think it's just the baby. My aunts cousin has two boys, the first born at term, bout 7lbs. The 2nd born early, 10lb 15.5oz. My 2nd is bigger at 32wks than my 1st at 36wks.
Me and my bd were both about 4 Weeks early. Looks like there isnt much way to tell how big your bubba is going to be! Will have to wait and see!
